head.title: CITY GUIDE SERVICE CALLS IT QUITS

identified-content.classifier: Top/Classifieds/Job Market/Job Categories/Technology, Telecommunications and Internet

hedline.hl1: CITY GUIDE SERVICE CALLS IT QUITS

abstract.p: Scout Electromedia, which introduced Modo wireless hand-held device and Modo.net city guide service in early September, shuts down after running out of money (S)

block.p: Scout Electromedia, which introduced the Modo wireless hand-held device and the Modo.net city guide service in early September, shut down after running out of money. The Modo wireless devices, which were sold for $99, provided event and restaurant listings and articles over Modo.net. Investors in Scout Electromedia included Idealab, Chase Capital Partners and Flatiron Partners. The service had several thousand users, according to Ken Miller, an editor at Modo.net.

Scout Electromedia, which introduced the Modo wireless hand-held device and the Modo.net city guide service in early September, shut down after running out of money. Investors in Scout Electromedia included Idealab, Chase Capital Partners and Flatiron Partners. The service had several thousand users, according to Ken Miller, an editor at Modo.net.
